issues.title: Final review of I-D before submission (of version 9)
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body: By Weds 10th Feb

comments.author: dperdices
comments.body:
I leave here my review. Most of the things are typos, inconsistencies and minor issues. As you see, it is divided in the same sections of the document so that it is easier to find the issues.

Anything I get wrong, please let me know


-----------------------------------------------------
## 1 Introduction
* ITU recommendations should be cite in a consistent way, i.e. instead of `G.694.1 [G.694.1] and G.872 [G.872]`, it should be `[G.694.1] and [G.872]`, the same way we cite RFCs or drafts.

* Typo `flexi-grid elements..`

## 3 Tree diagram

### 3.1 Prefixes in Data Node Names

* Should caption of the table be `Table 1:...` instead of `Figure 1:...`?

## 4 Example of use

* We should only keep the second version of the figure instead of both of them. 

* Reference in text should be `Figure 2` in this version, but as I pointed out in 3.1, maybe Figure 1 should be Table and this closes this issue.

## 6 Yang code 

* In contact leaf, Dan's email is not the same of section Authors' Addresses. (Not an issue but a piece of information for Dan in case he didn't notice).

* I think that should change the reference and description and use `RFC YYYY` instead of `RFC XXXX`. We have in section 3.1 this note 

```
RFC Editor Note: Please replace XXXX with the RFC numbers assigned to
draft-ietf-ccamp-layer0-types.  Please replace YYYY with the RFC
number assigned to this document.  Please remove this note.
```

and in the yang code this note

```
This version of this YANG module is part of RFC XXXX; see
the RFC itself for full legal notices.";

revision 2020-10-21 {
description
    "Initial Version";
reference
    "RFC XXXX: A YANG Data Model for Flexi-Grid Optical Networks";
// RFC Ed.: replace XXXX with actual RFC number, update date
// information and remove this note
}
```

It's not a big issue but something kind to the RFC Editors so that they can replace XXXX with RFC number for layer0-types and YYYY with our document's number :)

* Only validation warning is the one I pointed out in last meeting (solved in layer-0-types)

## 7 Security considerations

* `Secure Shell (SSH)` is used there three times. Should we just expand the first time? Maybe keep the ones that are titles of RFCs?  Also, should we expand TLS or is already well-known?

## 9 Contributors

* Daniel Michaud's corporative email should be `daniel.michaud@estudiante.uam.es` but it is probably already disabled. Jorge should confirm this.

* Maybe, for consistency, we should ask Victor and Oscar to have also their second surname as Jorge and I do. Or remove our second surname. It's not such a big deal in any case and should be left to each one's discretion.

* Italo's affiliation (Huawei) is not the same as Haomian's (Huawei Technologies). (Maybe they are different companies and I am messing this up, my apologies in advance in that case :) )

## 11 References

### 11.1 Normative references

* `Madrid, U.` should be `Lopez de Vergara, J. E.`

* `Lopezalvarez, V` should be `Lopez, V.` (or `Lopez-Alvarez, V.`)

* `Dios, O.` should be `Gonzalez de Dios, O.`

### 11.2 Informative references

* `ITUT` should be `ITU-T`
-------------------------------------

comments.author: jorgelopezdevergara
comments.body:
Given that Daniel Perdices is now working at Universidad Autónoma de Madrid, maybe we can switch these affiliations (as I am also at Naudit), to keep this information updated.

Daniel Perdices and I need to add acknowledgements to a national project (probably, instead of Trafica project that is currently there), and to a research scholar for Daniel Perdices. The new acks would be the "This work is also partially funded by the Spanish State Research Agency under the project AgileMon (AEI PID2019-104451RB-C21) and by the Spanish Ministry of Science, Innovation and Universities under the program for the training of university lecturers (Grant number: FPU19/05678)."

With respect to Daniel Michaud e-mail, I have his personal e-mail. I'm not sure if he needs to be contacted by e-mail, as he worked on this with me at the beginning of the draft. If the e-mail is needed, we can put his UAM e-mail (daniel.michaud@estudiante.uam.es). 

Also need to update affiliation in YANG code.

issues.title: Section 4 - Example of Use
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body:
"Thank you first of all for putting together an example to help folks understand the different terminologies used in the document. However, I am confused whose perspective does the example present. The paragraph starts by saying "In order to configure a network media channel ...", which to me sounds like a client *configuring* the network media channel. How does configuring of nodes A and E provide connectivity towards the node interface? Or did you mean to say that the act of configuring nodes A and E will somehow bring up the connection towards the node interface?"

I (Dan) plan to update as follows: 

>> In order to configure a path between A and E, the operator. 
>> Remove “we” 
>> “Transponders A & E are the path termination points”

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: Fixed in latest version.

issues.title: Application Example
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body:
The document says - "An application example is provided towards the end of the document to better understand the utility of this YANG model." However, no such example exists in the document. With no example, how is an operator supposed to know how to use the module. Besides, there is no way to know that this model is even valid.

The example is/will (be) provided in the media channel. Will updated text and point to reference in media channel I-D.

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: Dan and Oscar to have skype call and discuss.

issues.title: Container and When Statements
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body:
"What is not clear with the model is the first container and the when statement. As another YANG doctor explained, the when-stmt applies to *instances* of a model, not to the schema. Therefore a when-stmt that points back to a node that is part of schema and is a presence container does not achieve what I think the authors intended, i.e. a when condition."

Having looked at other examples, several CCAMP documents make use of "when" statements, but non-CCAMP I-Ds do not. Do we really need the "when" statement? To me “when” might apply to a data object, such as “true” “false” “3”, etc.

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body:
We should also check usage for WSON I-D. 

WSON YANG Dr Review - https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/review-ietf-ccamp-wson-yang-15-yangdoctors-lc-lindem-2018-11-13/
WSON https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-ccamp-wson-yang-15 in version 15 they commented out.

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: Dan to check with NETMOD, but it looks like a legitimate use of the "when" statement as applied other TE documents.

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
Aihua and I have made some checks on:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5689966/how-to-check-if-an-element-exists-in-the-xml-using-xpath/5690522

https://www.w3.org/TR/1999/REC-xpath-19991116/#booleans

It seems to us that the current when statements are correct since the boolean () XPath function is automatically applied and it returns true when the node exists

However, it is still good to double check with NETMOD

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: Legitimate use to be highlighted on list when we submit version 11.

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body:
<tp>
I commented before that I struggle with the complexity of the 'when' statements in many CCAMP and TEAS I-D such as this one.

Is it
      when "../../../../../../../../../../"
          + "nw:network-types/tet:te-topology/"
 or
      when "../../../../../../../../../"
          + "nw:network-types/tet:te-topology/"
 or
      when "../../../../../../../nw:network-types/tet:te-topology/"

? answer all of them depending!

I speculated that the absolute form of the path statement would be much simpler but it was pointed out to me by Martin that that would not work as 'nw:network is a list and so would return true if 'flexi-grid-topology' appeared anywhere in the list which in this case it is almost bound to; but there is the XPath 'ancestor' function which returns true only if the value appears in an immediate ancestor of the context node.  This is almost what I want the caveat being that it returns true if any of the predicates - e.g. primary-path, route-object-exclude-object, etc -  has the value  in question but I believe that that will never be the case.

In which case,
 when "ancestor::node()/nw:network-types/tet:te-topology"
as proposed by Lada will do the job for almost all the 'when' statements (and I can understand it ).

The thread is on the netmod WG list from 29dec21 under the subject
YANG 'when' with absolute path

Tom Petch

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body:
Lets investigate use of xpath ancestor (parent/grandparent) see: 

https://www.educba.com/xpath-ancestor/

How widespread is this function in IETF YANG modules? 

Sergio and Italo will inspect further and we will also need to check with other similar implementations.

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
YANG model updated but we have found some issues with yanglint compilation:

https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/netmod/SvYTvbqNEeBT5IL74xtDQYwfy_A/

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body:
Pyang compilation does not return any error/warnings, but when we use yanglint we see errors as it does recognize ancestor statements. 

Response from Michal Vaško <mvasko@cesnet.cz> Tue, 18 January 2022 07:07 UTCShow header

>>
Hi,

yanglint uses its own XPath implementation, which unfortunately does not support axes, hence the error.

Regards,
Michal
<<

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body:
YANG experts have confirmed the YANG xpath axes ancestor structure and function is reasonable, but not widely used in other IETF modules, and we can ignore the libyang compilation errors due to a lack of support for axes.  

We will summerise the situation with WG and ask other implementers for feedback. 

- Dan to email CCAMP WG for flexi-grid module feedback
- All, decide if we should present an update on the issue to NETMOD and/or CCAMP at IETF 113 (March)

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: An ongoing discussion with NETMOD and tools team Re: XPATH ancestor function. Although the NETMOD team is not negative towards using ancestor function in our model(s), the tools are not able to cope with the function, and we may need to revert ro a more conservative approach.

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: Reverted to YANG code that uses absolute path, in version 12.

issues.title: Augmentation Statements
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body:
"The second general comments has to do with the 80 augment statements. As an operator, I would find it very tedious to configure this model, what with 80 different XPaths to follow. Would it not be better to gather all the augmenting (flexi-grid) parameters together and use leafrefs to link these data structures to the ietf-network module?"

This does seem like a valid comment? When wandering down the branches of the tree, why not add a whole new branch augmentation with the new objects in a single branch augmentation, instead of lots of augmentations?

comments.author: dperdices
comments.body: To provide more information, the actual version follows the example provided in RFC8795, see https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8795#appendix-C.

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
This issue was discussed upfront with Netmod WG:

https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/netmod/-6L8KYVVhFiS8KpmH2fUpBmdSy8/

Appendix C of RFC8795 is based on the feedbacks received from Netmod WG.

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: Legitimate used to be highlighted on list when we submit version 11.

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: Continued in issue #28

issues.title: Tree Structure
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body:
Having 17 pages of a tree diagram without any explanation for the different sections of the tree diagram is hardly helpful. On the other hand an abridged version of the tree diagram explaining the different sections would be more helpful normative text. Suggest that --tree-depth and --tree-path options be used in pyang to reduce the size of the tree and to break it up into smaller
pieces that can then be explained. The full tree diagram can be added as non-normative text in the Appendix.

This is a valid comment, having looked at other YANG models I found https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-opsawg-l3sm-l3nm-07#section-7 as a good example.

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
Please find some proposed text for clause 5 (similar to the text we have provided for OTN topology) to address this issue

[draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang-09-ib@2021-04-26.docx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/6390242/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang-09-ib%402021-04-26.docx)

Please note that this document contains also some review comments to other sections of the draft (for further discussion)

comments.author: dperdices
comments.body:
Thank you, Italo! In my opinion, this new section 5 is really explanatory and makes the model easier to understand so readers will surely appreciate it.

I leave here some minor issues to check before merging. (English-related things should be double-checked by @danielkinguk, just in case I report things that are in fact correct, my apologies in advance).
- "Therefore the YANG" => "Therefore, the YANG"
- "an Flexi-Grid" => "a flexi-grid"
- In the rest of the document, we use flexi-grid (with this capitalization, instead of Flexi-Grid)
- Section 3.2 should not be 3.2 but 5.X. In general, when merging this, we should revise the section numbering.
- "in the topology as follow." => "in the topology as follows:"
- "Therefore the model does not define" => "Therefore, the model does not define"

issues.author: danielkinguk

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: Please let me have comments by Tuesday 19, 2021.

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
I think the -11 version is ready for submission. I have few comments that could be addressed either before -11 submission or afterwards (before or during WG LC):

1. an English review would be helpful.
    For example, “the following example is provided” instead of “we provide the following example”)
2. In the introduction it would be useful to clarify that this model does not require GMPLS implementation:
    **OLD**
         This document presents a YANG data model [RFC7950] for flexi-grid
         objects in the dynamic optical network, including nodes, transponders
         and links, as well as how such links interconnect nodes. 
    **NEW**
         This document presents a YANG data model [RFC7950] for flexi-grid
         objects in the dynamic optical network, including nodes, transponders
         and links, as well as how such links interconnect nodes. This model is
         independent of control plane protocols.
3. The use of term "media channel" thought the document needs to be reviewed, in line with https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-media-channel-yang/issues/33
4. The layer0-types I-D has now been published as RFC9093

issues.title: LC Review from Tom
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body:
<tp>
wrong YANG  prefix (s.9)

After all the discussions on CCAMP and TEAS WG lists about what would make for a good prefix, this does not bode well - sigh

<tp2>
And while I am on the admin ...

The dates ib the module are wrong but differently wrong in different places - if it were all the same wrong I would live with it.

Security Considerations make no mention of any nodes in this I-D - I doubt if the AD will countenance that.

RFC Editor Note Please replace XXXX with the numbers assigned to RFC9093 Really?  Look in the YANG module revision reference and you may think again

TLP is out of date

Copyright out of date  - perhaps 2022!

URL lack security (https:) in several places

URL to an obsolete web page (tool)

[G.694.1] .... G-872
Really?

As I have commented before, it is a pig to review because TE got its YANG structure wrong in the first place so whether or not I will look at the semantics of the model , I do not know - perhaps if Boxing Day gets very boring:-)

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body:
1. Date used in file name and revision needs to be consistent. (DK)

2. For "RFC XXXX" and "RFC YYYY" need to check usage within I-D for consistency  (DK)

3. IANA Section referred to old prefix. (DK)

OLD
   IANA is requested to assign a new YANG module name in the "YANG
    Module Names" registry [RFC6020] as follows:

          Name: ietf-flexi-grid-topology
          Namespace: urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:yang:ietf-flexi-grid-topology
          Prefix: flexi-grid-topology
          Reference: [This.I-D]
NEW
   IANA is requested to assign a new YANG module name in the "YANG
    Module Names" registry [RFC6020] as follows:

          Name: ietf-flexi-grid-topology
          Namespace: urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:yang:ietf-flexi-grid-topology
          Prefix: flexgt
          Reference: RFC XXXX

4. Need to check how we reference an ITU-T amendment. (see Issue #41)

5. Security issues in code, check WSON TOPO (9094) and TE TOPO [RFC8795] (DK)

6. URL usage should be "https" - Check uses of "http" and use "https" wherever possible (DK)

7. Time to move from "Informational" to "Standards Track"? Italo to raise on list. - We should change to "Standards" (DK)

Also waiting on additional comments from LC.

issues.title: How we reference an ITU-T amendment
issues.author: italobusi
issues.body:
Need to check how we reference an ITU-T amendment.

_Originally posted by @danielkinguk in https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/issues/40#issuecomment-1000293680_

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
I have checked for some guidelines or previous examples but I have not found any common guidelines nor consistent examples ...

Few options an input for further discussion (other options or a combination of these options are also possible):

OLD
```
   [G.694.1]  International Telecommunication Union, "Spectral grids for
              WDM applications: DWDM frequency grid", ITUT G.872,
              February 2012.

   [G.872]    International Telecommunication Union, "Architecture of
              optical transport networks", ITUT G.872, November 2010.

```
NEW (option 1)
```
   [G.694.1]  International Telecommunication Union, "Spectral grids for
              WDM applications: DWDM frequency grid", ITU-T Recommendation G.694.1,
              October 2020.

   [G.872]    International Telecommunication Union, "Architecture of
              optical transport networks", ITU-T Recommendation G.872, December 2019.

```
NEW (option 2)
```
   [ITU-T_G.694.1]  International Telecommunication Union, "Spectral grids for
              WDM applications: DWDM frequency grid", ITU-T Recommendation G.694.1,
              October 2020.

   [ITU-T_G.872]    International Telecommunication Union, "Architecture of
              optical transport networks", ITU-T Recommendation G.872, December 2019.

```
NEW (option 3)
```
   [ITU-T_G.694.1]  ITU-T, "Spectral grids for
              WDM applications: DWDM frequency grid", ITU-T Recommendation G.694.1,
              October 2020.

   [ITU-T_G.872]    ITU-T, "Architecture of
              optical transport networks", ITU-T Recommendation G.872, December 2019.

```
NEW (option 4)
```
   [ITU-T_G.694.1]  ITU-T, "Spectral grids for
              WDM applications: DWDM frequency grid", ITU-T Recommendation G.694.1,
              October 2020.

   [ITU-T_G.872]    ITU-T, "Architecture of
              optical transport networks", ITU-T Recommendation G.872, Amendment 1, January 2021.

```
NEW (option 5)
```
   [ITU-T_G.694.1]  International Telecommunications Union – Telecommunications Sector (ITU-T), "Spectral grids for
              WDM applications: DWDM frequency grid", ITU-T Recommendation G.694.1,
              October 2020.

   [ITU-T_G.872]    International Telecommunications Union – Telecommunications Sector (ITU-T), "Architecture of
              optical transport networks", ITU-T Recommendation G.872, Amendment 1, January 2021.

```

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
Possible split of the different options:
1) Citation:
   1) [G.872] 
   2) [ITU-T_G.872] (Preferred)
2) Source: 
   1) International Telecommunication Union (Preferred)
   2) ITU-T
   3) International Telecommunications Union – Telecommunications Sector (ITU-T)
3) version:
   1) ITU-T Recommendation G.872, December 2019 
   2) ITU-T Recommendation G.872, Amendment 1, January 2021 (Preferred)

issues.title: LC Review from Adrian
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body:
tl;dr This is ready for publication with some nits that need to be
sorted out.

Best,
Adrian

===

Throughout:

Please resolve "Flexi-Grid" or "flexi-grid"

---

As a general comment, I think it was only clear to me on reading sections
6 and 7 that this YANG module is entirely made up of individual 
augmentations of leaf nodes defined in other modules. That's not a 
problem, but it might helpful to highlight this in Section 1.

---

Section 1

   This document identifies the flexi-grid components, parameters and
   their values, characterizes the features and the performances of the
   flexi-grid elements.

I think this should be

   This document identifies the flexi-grid components, parameters, and
   their values.  It characterizes the features and the performances of
   the flexi-grid elements.

---

Section 3

   RFC Editor Note: Please replace XXXX with the RFC numbers assigned to
   [RFC9093].  Please replace YYYY with the RFC number assigned to this
   document.  Please remove this note.

I suspect that the number for XXXX is 9093 :-)

Note, however, that in Section 7 you use XXXX for this document. It may
help the RFC editor if you are consistent.

---

Section 4

OLD
      We also provide nodes A
      and B identifiers, addresses and interfaces.
NEW
      We also provide the identifiers, addresses and interfaces of nodes
      A and B.
END

s/Figure 1 shows a simple topology./Figure 2 shows a simple topology./

---

5.1

s/This document aims to describe/This document describes/
s/Traffic-engineering (TE)/traffic engineering (TE)/
s/Grid provide WDM/Grid provides WDM/
s/Traffic Engineered (TE)/TE/
s/identities and groupings/identities, and groupings/
s/The figure below/Figure 3/
s/describing an Flexi-Grid/describing a Flexi-Grid/
s/specifies with/specifies the/

---

5.1

   The Flexi-Grid specific attributes in [RFC7699], including the grid
   type, channel spacing, slot width granularity, n and m parameters,
   can be used to represent the label information.

Perhaps I am being pedantic, but isn't the label a representation of 
those parameters, not the other way round?

---

5.2.  Attributes Augmentation

   There are a few characteristics augmenting to the generic TE
   topology.

I think, probably...

5.2.  Augmentations for Flexi-Grid Topology and Node

   There are a few augmentations to the generic TE topology as described
   in this section.

---

5.2

s/topology as follows./topology as shown in Figure 4./
s/is a Flexi-Grid node/is a Flexi-Grid node as shown in Figure 5./

---

5.3

/layer0/Layer 0/
s/to describe also/to also describe/

---

Section 5.3 contains a little surprise. "Here are the bandwidth 
augmentations: there are n bandwidth augmentations."

Perhaps resolve this by adding a paragraph at the very top of the 
section to say...

   No bandwidth augmentations are needed for this YANG module.

Then the rest of the section will appear as an explanation.

---

5.4

   The model augments all the occurrences of the label-restriction list
   with flexi-grid technology specific attributes using the flexi-grid-
   label-range-info grouping defined in [RFC9093].

Can you add a reference for where the label-restriction list is 
defined. I think it is RFC 8795.

---

7.

   module ietf-flexi-grid-topology {
     description
       "This module provides a YANG data model for the routing and
        wavelength assignment (RWA) Traffic Engineering (TE)
        topology in flexi-grid optical networks. The YANG model
        described in this document is a flexi-grid technology-specific
        YANG model augmenting the generic TE topology module
        (ietf-te-topology, RFC 9795) based on the RFC 7698 and 7699.

s/based on the RFC 7698 and 7699./based on RFC 7698 and RFC 7699./

---

7.

Obviously, the copyright date is broken in the YANG

issues.title: Remove NMDA statement from the abstract
issues.author: italobusi
issues.body:
Dhruv suggests "removing the NMDA statement from the abstract, you have it covered in the Introduction"

I have checked RFC8407 and it seems that the NMDA statement is needed only in the Introduction:

https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8407#section-3.5

issues.title: Muxponders' configuration constraints
issues.author: italobusi
issues.body:
During ACTN POI discussion, it has been noted that "in MXPs usually the client ports are assigned to the time slots by default (or by design)".

See: https://github.com/FabioPeruzzini/actn-poi/issues/108

If the muxponder can constraint which client ports can be connected together, this constraint shall be reported to the MDSC through the MPI but this information is not defined in the existing topology YANG models.

It is not yet clear how this constraint can be reported and whether this information should be reported by the flexi-grid topology model (e.g., a V2 version of the model) or by the optical impairments topology model

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body:
Need to decide what configuration information/attribute constraints to report and then update the model/document.

https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8795#name-te-inter-layer-lock

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
Slide discussed during the meeting: [mxp-constraints-00.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10466574/mxp-constraints-00.pptx)


The inter-layer lock indicates that the 10 LTPs on node A (or node Z) can be connected to a WDM tunnel starting from the TTP in node A (or in node Z, respectively)

If at least one of the two muxponders support a flexible multiplexing label allocation, the 10GE service between MXP-A-1 and MXP-Z-5 is feasible

If the two muxponders support a fixed multiplexing label allocation, the 10GE service between MXP-A-1 and MXP-Z-5 is not feasible while the 10GE service between MXP-A-1 and MXP-Z-1 is feasible.

From the inter-layer lock information it seems possible to setup a 10GE service between MXP-A-1 and MXP-Z-5, so additional information is needed to report when there are additional constraints that make it not possible

In many cases the multiplexing label is proprietary. It is therefore also important to check that the two muxponders support the same multiplexing label. The type of multiplexing label can also report whether the label allocation is fixed or flexible.

In order to report the type of multiplexing label, it has been agreed to re-use the switching-capability*  with vendor-specific values for vendor-proprietary multiplexing types

However, even if the type of multiplexing label reports that the label allocation is fixed, the information about which LTP is associated with which label or muxponder physical port is still missing

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body:
Created some examples. 

[Muxponder Constraints v1.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10795160/Muxponder.Constraints.v1.pptx)

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
When the the mapping/multiplexing technology is proprietary, the two muxponders shall be under the control of the same PNC so any proprietary configuration can be managed by the PNC with no need to be exposed at the MPI toward the MDSC. However, these constraints have an impact on the pair of LTPs the MDSC can request the service setup and therefore it is worthwhile to expose it at the MPI through a standardized YANG model

However, the solution should be generic enough not to depend on any specific standard or proprietary mapping/multiplexing technology

Proposed resolution:

```
       +--rw termination-point* [tp-id]
         +--rw tp-id?   ...
         +--rw te-tp-id?   te-types:te-tp-id
         +--rw te!
            ...
            +--rw inter-layer-lock-id*              uint32
            +--rw inter-layer-sequence-number?      uint32

```

[Muxponder.Constraints.v2.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/11507738/Muxponder.Constraints.v2.pptx)

comments.author: italobusi
danielkinguk

issues.title: Support for a single and multiple topology instance across multi-layer networks
issues.author: italobusi
issues.body:
It seems that there are gaps when the current flexi-grid topology model is used to support a single topology instance across multi-layer networks, using network types multi-inheritance.

For example, it might be possible to use multi-inheritance to expose a single topology instance across flexi-grid, OTN and ETH networks:

```
      |  +--rw tet:te-topology!
      |     +--rw flexigt:flexi-grid-topology!
      |     +--rw otnt:otn-topology!
      |     +--rw eth-tet:eth-tran-topology!
```

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
**2023-01-26 Flexi-grid call**

Some details about the issues identified with the current flexi-grid, OTN and ETH topology models, as discussed during the audio today:

[current-ml-topology-models-00.txt](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10510413/current-ml-topology-models-00.txt)

Some initial brainstorming analysis for possible options to resolve di issue, , as discussed during the audio today:

[new-ml-topology-models-00.txt](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10510430/new-ml-topology-models-00.txt)

comments.body:
Created topology examples for single instance and multiple topologies over multi-layer networks. 

[MLN Topologies v1.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10795135/MLN.Topologies.v1.pptx)

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body: It is worth noting that the flexibility to support either multiple single-layer topology instances or a single multi-layer topology instance (see slides 6 and 4 in [MLN.Topologies.v2.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10871263/MLN.Topologies.v2.pptx)) is similar to the options for GMPLS as described in [RFC5212](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5212) (thanks to @sergiobelotti for the reference)

issues.title: Boundary between Layer 0 and Layer 1
issues.author: italobusi
issues.body:
Since 3R modelling is in the scope of this document, I think that the layer 1 functionality of the transponders are also in the scope of this document.

For example, the inverse multiplexing and FEC are layer 1 functionality of the transponders which are in the scope of this document.

Maybe it is a terminology issue. IMHO, the aggregation (multiplexing) of client layer signals is performed by muxponders and not by transponders. A muxponder can be modelled as a layer 1 functionality providing the aggregation (multiplexing) of client layer signals and a transponder functionality. In this case, I agree that the aggregation (multiplexing) of client layer signals is outside the scope of this document.

I do not recall if these issues have been all addressed in the 3R model (need to double check).

My suggestion is to keep the text as it is now and to track this as an issue for discussion after IETF 112.

_Originally posted by @italobusi in https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-optical-impairment-topology-yang/pull/94#discussion_r734500969_

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
As discussed during yesterday's call, the text description needs further improvements to clarify the boundary between what is in the scope (layer 0) and what is out of scope (layer 1)

[layer0-boundary-00.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-optical-impairment-topology-yang/files/7425089/layer0-boundary-00.pptx)

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
Slides updated with more detailed examples of transponders and muxponders:

[layer0-boundary-01.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-optical-impairment-topology-yang/files/8255504/layer0-boundary-01.pptx)

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body: Need to discuss how/what to model/map for Layer 0 and Layer 1, including the types, functions and capabilities, at each specific layer. This may include: 3R, multiplexing, FEC, encryption, et al. This should not preclude implementation options. It would be useful to look at higher-layer examples (L1/L2/L3). This description/advice would then be documented in a specific document, which is currently undecided - could be existing I-D or new I-D.

comments.author: aguoietf
comments.body: Issue is tracked and discussed in [RFC9093-bis #81](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/ietf-ccamp-layer0-types-ext-RFC9093-bis/issues/81)

issues.title: Working Group update on open issues and proposed resolution of Flexi-Grid Topology
issues.author: danielkinguk
issues.body:
A few slides summarising the current issues affecting the Flexi-Grid topology document.  
[Open Issues for Flexi-Grid v2.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10756205/Open.Issues.for.Flexi-Grid.v2.pptx)

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body:
Proposed email to AD, Chairs and Working Group. 

>>
Dear John, Chairs and Working Group, 

As you know, the authors of the Flexi-Grid Topology requested to pause the document (before the AD Review) as additional requirements were proposed that would require a substantive change to the Flexi-Grid Topology I-D (draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang).

Several authors of the affected I-Ds and related documents have concluded our initial analysis. We feel a new approach (YANG model) may be required to address the requirements for mixed technology environments. Furthermore, we have highlighted these requirements in key uses (Slides) documented in the following GitHub issue (57):

https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/issues/57

As mentioned, a solution may require a new single modular optical model that can be used for multiple technologies, or a new layer-0 optical model with extended capabilities for specific higher-layer technologies, or adapting the existing work-in-progress models. We have not decided which solution to pursue and will seek consensus from the current authors and the wider CCAMP community.

We will provide a more detailed update during the CCAMP session at IETF 116, including the following:

1.            A summary of the technology impacted, requirements and use cases
2.            Which documents are affected?
3.            How to address the requirements and use cases, single modular model or multiple new/updated models? 
4.            What do we intend to do with the affected documents (modify or start a new I-D)?
5.            Provide an overview of the new (or modified) YANG model(s) to address the requirements and use case scenarios
6.            Propose a sequence of actions

During the IETF 116 CCAMP meeting, we hope to receive feedback from the wider CCAMP community. 

BR, Dan (on behalf of the Flexi-Grid discussion participants).  
<<

comments.author: danielkinguk
comments.body:
Version 3 of the requirements and use case, slides. 

[MLN.Topologies.v3.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10872173/MLN.Topologies.v3.pptx)

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
> Version 3 of the requirements and use case, slides.
> 
> [MLN.Topologies.v3.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10872173/MLN.Topologies.v3.pptx)

I would suggest to remove (or to move in backup) the physical layer topology cases:
- it is a new, potentially controversial, requirement which still needs to be discussed and could cause unnecessary opposition to the work; 
- it increases the number of scenarios causing loss of focus on the urgent requirements we need to be addressed; 
- if we are able to update the current models to be more modular, adding the physical topology in a modular way at a later stage will not be an issue

issues.title: Type of node
issues.author: italobusi
issues.body:
In a multi-technology network topology instance, there is a need to identify the type of node (e.g., OTN, flexi-grid, ...)

There are two options to define the type of node:
1) implicit based on the type of LTPs of the node (e.g., a node is an OTN node if it has at least one OTN LTP)
2) explicit based on some presence containers

See: https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10510430/new-ml-topology-models-00.txt

Need to decide which option to adopt and change the YANG model(s) accordingly

Note that RFC9093 defines a `wson-node` presence container to explicitly indicate that the node is a WSON node

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
**2023-05-04 Flexi-grid call**

Preference expressed for option 2

- [ ] @italobusi update the proposal in PR #65 accordingly

issues.title: Type of LTP
issues.author: italobusi
issues.body:
In a multi-technology network topology instance, there is a need to identify the type of LTP (e.g., OTN, flexi-grid, ...)

There are two options to define the type of LTP:
1) implicit based on the type of Links terminated on the LTP
2) explicit based on some presence containers and the `interface-switching-capability` list
3) implicit when the LTP terminates one or more Links or explicit when the LTP does not terminate any Link (e.g., at the edge of a network domain)

Notes:
- if solution 1) is adopted:
  1. inter-domain links MUST always be reported as open-ended Links (to report the type of Link)
  2. the `interface-switching-capability` list, defined in RFC8795, is always empty
- if solution 2) is adopted there will be duplication of information between the type of Link and the type of LTP when the LTP terminates one or more Links

See: https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/10510430/new-ml-topology-models-00.txt

Need to decide which option to adopt and change the YANG model(s) accordingly

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body: Some slides describing the two options as discussed during the call on 2023-04-27: [inter-domain-ltp-00.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/11371091/inter-domain-ltp-00.pptx)

comments.author: italobusi
comments.body:
**2023-05-25 Weekly call**

With option 2 there is duplication of information in the data schema as well as in the data instance (at least for intra-domain links). With option 3 there is duplication only in the data schema but not in the data instance (the information is reported either on the LTP or on the Link terminated by the LTP but not on both).

With option 3 we need to describe that the information in the LTP cannot be present in the data instance when the LTP is terminating a Link: need to check if this condition can be enforced with YANG syntax (e.g., with a `when` statement), see issue ietf-ccamp-wg/transport-nbi#107

Advantages of option 1 and 3 is to avoid duplicated information in the data instance which can be inconsistent.

Advantages of option 2 and 3 is that they allow not reporting open-ended links, which could be hard to define in case the LTP in unconnected.

Agreement to propose option 3 to CCAMP WG

- [ ] @italobusi : update the YANG model in PR ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang#65

comments.author: sergiobelotti
comments.body:
> Some slides describing the two options as discussed during the call on 2023-04-27: [inter-domain-ltp-00.pptx](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/files/11371091/inter-domain-ltp-00.pptx)

I think we should update the slides considering also Option 3. We can exploit today's meeting to adjourn that together.

comments.author: sergiobelotti
comments.body:
> **2023-05-25 Weekly call**
> 
> With option 2 there is duplication of information in the data schema as well as in the data instance (at least for intra-domain links). With option 3 there is duplication only in the data schema but not in the data instance (the information is reported either on the LTP or on the Link terminated by the LTP but not on both).
> 
> With option 3 we need to describe that the information in the LTP cannot be present in the data instance when the LTP is terminating a Link: need to check if this condition can be enforced with YANG syntax (e.g., with a `when` statement), see issue ietf-ccamp-wg/transport-nbi#107
> 
> Advantages of option 1 and 3 is to avoid duplicated information in the data instance which can be inconsistent.
> 
> Advantages of option 2 and 3 is that they allow not reporting open-ended links, which could be hard to define in case the LTP in unconnected.
> 
> Agreement to propose option 3 to CCAMP WG
> 
> * [ ]  @italobusi : update the YANG model in PR [Updates to support multi-layer topology instances #65](https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/pull/65)

Option 3 means that in case of inter-domain link and then the need to use LTP information you need presence container or just using interface-switching-capabilitity-list grouping or both?

comments.author: sergiobelotti
danielkinguk
comments.body: Need to develop text that describes how the multi-technology single instance will be used and we can then decide where to place the text, in the flexi-grid topo I-D, another I-D, all technology (Ethernet, OTN, MPLS, et al.) I-Ds?

comments.body:
I've updated the slide for what I remembered form the last week discussion.

pulls.title: Align with the scope of WSON topology
pulls.author: italobusi
pulls.body:
Aligned with the scope of wson-topology (spectrum allocation): see also https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-wson-yang/pull/3

Aligned also with the latest version of layer0-types

Co-authored-by: danielkinguk <dk@danielking.net>

comments.author: haomianzheng
comments.body:
> In general, the changes are all augmentation without explicit description of the scope of that augmentation: why to add that specific parameter/entity?
> Second, but it is not a problem of flex-grid, the module is using l0-types definitons , not clear and that need to be completed with better description. I put comment along the file.

A question for clarification on the first point, are we looking for 'why to add' or 'what to be added'? I am preferring the latter as it makes sense to explain how the augmentation is done and what can be achieved by providing guidances. To answer 'why' it's a problem more to generic TE models, not tech-specific models. 

I agree that we should give more explicit descriptions. The proper place is in this model, not in ietf-layer0-types. Once we confirm which grouping should be used, we need to indicate those leaf/list/container usage in the description section of this model.

comments.author: agva123
comments.body: Requested changes were discussed and addressed by Italo's commits.

Two comments here:
1) this is related to l0-types:l0-label-range-info: the  definition in l0-types is very confusing. The term label is misleading, I know the need for alignment with teas-topology, but a more clear description of which information is provided in the grouping is needed . 
2) Why you need to augment LTP source netry of connectiivty matrix with grid information? I possible to add  a brief description of the technical scope : since the term (label) is already misleading at least a clear description is needed.
see comment above.
Need a clear description of the scope of the augmentation with l0-label-range-info.
same as previous comment
same comment
Also for Local Link Connectivity List entries, it is needed an explanation of the scope of the augmentation with l0-labe-range-info. This comment is valid also of the previous augmentation of TTP.
Again , due to the misleading name , it is not clear the intention of this specific augmentation: label-range is in fact just information regarding the grid type
Also for te-link it is needed to have a description of the scope of this augmentation
l0-types:flexi-grid-label-start-end is practically the n value to claculate nominal central frequency.  Is possible to have a description of the meaning of this augmentation?
same as previous comment.

Again two problems:
1)  Augmentation description 
2) In l0-types  flexi-grid-label-hop description is not clear : what does it mean flexi grid path label ??  the content of the grouping seems to represent the frequency slot (n and m parameters for nominal central frequency and slot width).
Augmentation description and misleading term for flexi-grid-label-start-end: it is expecting two labels but instead is just one

reviews.author: sergiobelotti
reviews.body:
In general, the changes are all augmentation without explicit description of the scope of that augmentation: why to add that specific parameter/entity?
Second, but it is not a problem of flex-grid, the module is using l0-types definitons , not clear and that need to be completed with better description. I put comment along the file.

comments.body:
A follow up question here: 
Shall we use the grouping 'l0-label-range-info'? or 'flexi-grid-label-range-info'? both of them are defined in ietf-layer0-types, and I am preferring the latter, proposing a GLOBAL replacement of 'uses l0-types:l0-label-range-info' to 'uses l0-types:flexi-grid-label-range-info'. 

Checking the details of the two groupings: 
l0-label-range-info: provide grid-type (expected to be flexi-grid-dwdm here) and the priority in RFC4203; 
flexi-grid-label-range-info: include all l0-label-range-info, and also include SWG and min/max slot width factor, this grouping is specially designed for this module. 

Moreover, if we don't use flexi-grid-label-range-info in this module (as the current shape), we should remove it from layer0-types.
same above.

Not a question to this model but to flexi-grid scope: are we supporting super channel? We are not doing this in GMPLS flexi-grid, so that we suggest to remove it. 

Then we may need to change the layer0-types, and keep flexi-grid-label-hop to contain only single channel. (Let's report in the interim and then check whether we change l0-types or not. )

Regarding Sergio's comment (https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/pull/1/files?file-filters%5B%5D=.yang#r490981902), it seems worthwhile describing the concept of layer0 labels in layer0-types-ext draft:

https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/ietf-ccamp-layer0-types-ext/issues/5

Regarding Haomain's comment (https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/pull/1/files?file-filters%5B%5D=.yang#r491763723), the l0-types:flexi-grid-label-range-info grouping should be used: 

https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-flexigrid-yang/pull/1/commits/85704e1b86892b75fc63f15b649858662320a2ed
See comment above
See comment above
See comment above
See comment above
See comment above
See comment above
Description in layer0-types to be fixed: https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-layer0-types/pull/13
Description in layer0-types to be fixed: https://github.com/ietf-ccamp-wg/draft-ietf-ccamp-layer0-types/pull/13

> Not a question to this model but to flexi-grid scope: are we supporting super channel? We are not doing this in GMPLS flexi-grid, so that we suggest to remove it.
> 
> Then we may need to change the layer0-types, and keep flexi-grid-label-hop to contain only single channel. (Let's report in the interim and then check whether we change l0-types or not. )

agreed to withdraw the comment, i.e., include the super channel case in the module.

pulls.title: Fixing minor issues
pulls.author: dperdices
pulls.body:
While checking RFC 8407 (YANG Guidelines) and YANGDOCTORS reviews of draft-ietf-ccamp-layer0-types and draft-ietf-ccamp-wson-yang, I found some minor issues that can be easily fixed. Find next the changes we propose to fix them:

- In contact section, one of the mailto links was not a proper link.
- Description of the YANG module has been extended.
- Yang => YANG.
- Fixed some inconsistencies with the capitalization of Flexi-grid. Now, it is consistent with draft-ietf-ccamp-layer0-types.
- First occurrence of acronyms has been expanded.
- All descriptions end with a period/full stop.

comments.author: dperdices
comments.body: As pointed out by Jorge, [RFC7698](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7698) do already use a naming convention for flexi-grid. I changed the description of one of the augments thanks to Italo comments about te-node-attributes in last meeting.
